message: I experimented kdiff3, meld and vimdiff on Linux. Anything more I should check?
I've gone almost totally to vimdiff for anything non-trivial.
I also use vimdiff quite frequently.  When I ran OSX I tried using the OSX/XCode merger tool but it was not always as straightforward to use as vimdiff.
So far i like meld best I think. I should experiment more vimdiff though as vim is my text editor.
I swear by SourceGear's DiffMerge: http://www.sourcegear.com/diffmerge/
@wolever Thx for the pointer, I'll give it a try.
I often use vimdiff or kdiff3.  I tried setting it up to use gvim/mvim, but despite it seeming like it'd be easy, I never got it to quite work.
Most of the time I use p4merge.
On OS X I'm using FileMerge. With Linux and Windows I've used kdiff3 too.
